header_summary:
Antoine Poinsot highlighted the diverse and sometimes incorrect use of the term "vaults" within the Bitcoin community, stressing the importance of accurate terminology to prevent confusion. He introduced "Liana," a construct that opts for relative timelocks and integrates pruned Bitcoin Core node functionality for enhanced user accessibility, distinguishing it from Victor's proposal ([Bitcoin Ops](https://bitcoinops.org/en/topics/vaults/), [GitHub](https://github.com/wizardsardine/liana/)). Defenwycke's DustSweep proposal aims to efficiently clear Bitcoin's uneconomical dust through a non-exploitable transaction category, enhancing network efficiency without consensus changes, detailed further on [GitHub](https://github.com/defenwycke/bip-dust-sweep). 

Eric Voskuil's discourse on libbitcoin-database underlines its role in bolstering blockchain development through a performance-oriented, flexible design, separating validation processes to ensure integrity and efficiency ([source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/Q4RLVZW6OK88aVcalvUK7KJJIKOXckKhB7a5zTN7LTxA-jzal3587k4yUiIMjcIBoqLI0eK4uQLZtjJGsbj1R8zsfaMDM-RGSw2V9KI6AAw=@proton.me)). Discussions on handling large transactions within blockchain frameworks propose consensus rules to optimize block space and mempool management without compromising network health ([source](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/non-confiscatory-transaction-weight-limit/1732/10)). 

Meanwhile, debates on post-quantum cryptography's adequacy at a 128-bit security level against quantum attacks and the integration of Zero-Knowledge proofs for transaction flexibility reflect ongoing efforts to anticipate and mitigate future digital security challenges ([source](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/shrincs-324-byte-stateful-post-quantum-signatures-with-static-backups/2158/2)). These discussions underscore the dynamic nature of blockchain technology, emphasizing continuous innovation and the critical evaluation of security standards to address both current and emergent threats effectively.

recent_posts.title: Draft BIP: DustSweep – policy-only UTXO dust compaction
recent_posts.summary:
- The DustSweep proposal aims to clean up uneconomical "dust" in the Bitcoin UTXO set efficiently.
- It features transactions with specific conditions to avoid spam without changing consensus rules.
- Public feedback on the Bitcoin Improvement Proposal draft on GitHub is encouraged for refinement.

recent_posts.title: Non-confiscatory Transaction Weight Limit
recent_posts.summary:
- The proposal discusses managing blockchain transactions, focusing on efficiency and block stuffing concerns.
- It suggests allowing arbitrary sizes for the first and last transactions, imposing weight limits on others.
- A novel mining strategy involves categorizing transactions into buckets for optimal inclusion and fee maximization.

recent_posts.title: SHRINCS: 324-byte stateful post-quantum signatures with static backups
recent_posts.summary:

- Assessing cryptographic strength necessitates quantum-resistant metrics against future quantum tech capabilities.
- Cryptographic practices must evolve to stay ahead of potential vulnerabilities in a quantum-advanced world.

active_posts.title: Motion to Activate BIP 3
active_posts.summary:
- BIP 3 was moved to "Proposed" status in March 2025 after completing necessary work in February.
- An active GitHub pull request for activating BIP 3 has attracted significant support and discussion since April.
- Proposed changes include adopting SPDX License Expressions and refining the BIP process for clarity and functionality.

active_posts.title: A safe way to remove objectionable content from the blockchain
authors: A safe way to remove objectionable content from the blockchain Lazy Fair
active_posts.summary:
- The email proposes modifying Bitcoin blockchain to manage objectionable content without harming its integrity.
- It suggests two solutions: consensus level changes and client level adjustments for post-mining content filtration.
- These methods hinge on a sophisticated hashing technique, allowing data alteration without compromising blockchain's overall integrity.

authors: Hash-Based Signatures for Bitcoin's Post-Quantum Future 'Mikhail Kudinov'
active_posts.summary:
- Hash-based cryptographic solutions for Bitcoin focus on security against quantum attacks.
- Optimizations can significantly reduce the large signature sizes of hash-based schemes.
- The analysis underscores the importance of community dialogue on post-quantum cryptography integration.

active_posts.title: Dust Expiry: Clean the UTXO set from spam
active_posts.summary:
- A soft-fork proposes an age-based expiration for dust outputs to combat UTXO set spam.
- Since 2023, the UTXO set size doubled from 4.6 GB to 11 GB due to spam attacks.
- The solution makes small, old outputs unspendable, potentially reducing UTXO clutter.

active_posts.title: Benchmarking Bitcoin Script Evaluation for the Varops Budget (Great Script Restoration)
active_posts.summary:
- The new Tapscript leaf version addresses opcode concerns by introducing a varops budget linked to transaction weight.
- Benchmarking evaluates performance against a 20.8 billion compute units budget to ensure script validation efficiency.
- Community feedback on the varops budget through GSR prototype benchmarking is essential for refining the system.

active_posts.title: Bitcoin Embracing MimbleWimble
active_posts.summary:
- The Bitcoin community faces a divide on censorship, risking its foundational principles.
- A push for privacy through Mimblewimble could secure Bitcoin's original intent and fungibility.
- Without embracing privacy solutions, Bitcoin may veer towards centralization and lose its core values.

today_in_history_posts.title: Thoughts on scaling and consensus changes (2023)
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin's scalability requires 50,000 off-chain "banks" to serve 1 billion weekly users.
- Innovative solutions like Coinpools are at the forefront of scaling Bitcoin efficiently.
- A hybrid scaling system maintaining Bitcoin's integrity and enhancing security is likely.
